wikipedia_page.main:
Anna King, is a Scottish landscape artist "who seeks out forgotten spaces and derelict buildings."She was born in Shetland, spent most of her life in the Scottish Borders, and lives in the village of Greenlaw, near Kelso.
She first came to attention of the general public at her degree show at  Dundee's Duncan of Jordanstone College of Art and Design in 2005.

link_mentions.page: Duncan of Jordanstone College of Art & Design

response: *Anna King (singer) (1937–2002), American soul and gospel singer

First Prize: Anna King – Paintings in oil and pencil on paper and board. A "painter of quarries and wastelands, an original, modern voice in landscape art."John Lowrie Morrison - the Point of Views, Susan Mansfield, 2009 - prize of £20,000.
